1.content: **Erweitere** die bestehende Seite so, dass: 1. **Navigation & Unterseiten**    * Erstelle eine übersichtliche Hauptnavigation (Header + Footer) mit Links zu folgenden Unterseiten:       * **Startseite** (bestehende Landingpage)       * **Über uns**       * **Leistungen** (inkl. Bildergalerien / Beschreibungen, Platzhaltertexte)       * **Referenzen** (Projekte, Vorher-Nachher-Bilder, Kundenfeedback)       * **Kontakt** (Kontaktformular)    * Jede Unterseite soll im gleichen Stil, Farbthema und Layout wie die Hauptseite gestaltet werden (Farben basierend auf den vorhandenen Dateien).    * Die Navigation soll auf jeder Unterseite identisch sein und ein aktiver Link-Status anzeigen. 2. **Kontaktformular (Node.js)**    * Erstelle für die Kontaktseite ein funktionierendes Formular mit folgenden Feldern: Name, E-Mail, Telefonnummer, Nachricht.    * Verwende **Node.js + Express** als Backend, um das Formular per POST zu empfangen.    * Baue **E-Mail-Versand** ein (z. B. via Nodemailer) mit Absender, Betreff, Nachricht und Zeitstempel.    * Füge **Validierung** hinzu (Frontend + Backend).    * Implementiere **Google reCAPTCHA v3** oder hCaptcha zum Spam-Schutz.    * Gebe dem Nutzer eine Bestätigungsmeldung bei erfolgreichem Versand. 3. **Sicherheit**    * Stelle sicher, dass das Node.js-Backend **gegen Injection-Angriffe, XSS und CSRF** abgesichert ist.    * Verwende HTTPS (SSL-Zertifikat von Strato).    * Entferne alle unnötigen Server-Header, um keine Versionsinfos zu leaken.    * Implementiere `helmet` Middleware für zusätzliche Sicherheit. 4. **Hosting auf Strato**    * Gib mir eine **Schritt-für-Schritt-Anleitung**, wie ich:       * Die Domain bei Strato einrichte       * HTTPS/SSL aktiviere       * Die HTML/CSS/JS-Dateien hochlade       * Das Node.js-Backend auf Strato deploye (inkl. evtl. Workarounds wie externe Server, falls Strato kein direktes Node.js-Hosting bietet, z. B. über ein VPS oder PaaS) 5. **Optimierungen**    * Optimiere die Ladegeschwindigkeit (Bilder komprimieren, CSS/JS minifizieren).    * Sorge für Mobile-First-Responsivität.    * Füge Meta-Tags und strukturierte Daten (Schema.org) für SEO hinzu.    * Implementiere eine kleine Cookie-Consent-Bar. 6. **Logo-Anpassung**    * Ersetze das neues Logo, das die Silhouette eines Autos darstellt (Bild 2).    * Passe die Größe und Einbindung so an, dass das neue Logo in allen Bildschirmgrößen korrekt und scharf angezeigt wird. 7. **Sonstiges**    * Baue ein Favicon ein.    * Stelle sicher, dass die Farb- und Bildthemen aus den bisherigen Dateien beibehalten werden.    * Nutze nur lizenzfreie Bilder oder Platzhalter. Alles kann gerne in unterschiedlichen artefakten sein und bevor du dein generierlimit erreichst stop einfach, dann schreibe ich im nächsten prompt "Weiter" und dann gehts weiter.

1.content:
# TestRail Technical Deep Dive

TestRail stands as one of the established test case management platforms in the QA tools landscape, offering comprehensive testing workflow management through both cloud and on-premise deployment models. However, beneath its market presence lie significant technical and operational challenges that organizations should carefully evaluate before adoption or when considering migration alternatives.

## How TestRail functions as a test case management system

**TestRail operates as a centralized web-based platform** that serves as the single source of truth for all testing activities across software projects. The system employs a **hierarchical organizational structure** where Projects contain Test Suites, which are further organized into Sections and Sub-sections, ultimately housing individual Test Cases.

The platform's **core test execution workflow** revolves around creating Test Runs by selecting test cases from suites or applying dynamic filters. TestRail supports **five default test statuses** (Untested, Passed, Blocked, Retest, Failed) with real-time updates across the platform. Test Plans enable **comprehensive testing scenarios** by combining multiple test runs, while the milestone system tracks project progress against specific objectives like software releases.

**Integration capabilities represent TestRail's strength**, with native connections to CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins, GitHub Actions, GitLab CI/CD, Azure DevOps) and deep Jira integration for requirements traceability and defect management. The TestRail CLI enables **automated result submission** from popular testing frameworks including JUnit, TestNG, Cypress, Selenium, and Robot Framework, supporting both code-first and specification-first approaches to test automation.

The system's **role-based access control** provides granular permissions through built-in roles (Guest, Tester, Lead, Administrator) and customizable permission sets. Project-level administrators can manage projects without full system access, while enterprise features support GDPR compliance and advanced user management.

## TestRail's technical architecture and system design

**TestRail's architecture employs a traditional multi-tier web application design** built on proven technologies. The system runs on a **PHP 8.1 backend** with support for MySQL, MariaDB, or SQL Server databases, deployed on Apache HTTP Server (Linux) or IIS (Windows) environments.

The platform utilizes a **dual database architecture combining SQL and NoSQL** approaches - SQL databases handle relational data while Cassandra 3.11 provides enhanced scalability for high-volume operations. This **write-heavy optimization** addresses TestRail's core use case of frequent test result submissions and case updates.

**Key architectural components include** a modern web interface layer, comprehensive RESTful API v2 for integrations, separate file storage for attachments and reports, and background processing queues for bulk operations. The system supports **both cloud and on-premise deployment models** - TestRail Cloud runs on 100% Amazon AWS infrastructure with automated redundancy, while TestRail Server provides organizational control over installation and customization.

**Performance characteristics favor write operations** over read performance, with I/O performance typically representing the primary bottleneck. TestRail Enterprise supports **up to 300 API requests per minute** on segregated, resource-intensive cloud clusters. The platform requires **8GB+ RAM for larger installations** (100+ users) and benefits from high-speed disk configurations (10K/15K RPM) for optimal performance.

Security architecture incorporates **industry-standard TLS encryption**, multi-factor authentication, SAML 2.0/OAuth 2.0 SSO support, and LDAP/Active Directory integration. Enterprise deployments include SOC2/3, PCI, and ISO certifications with comprehensive audit logging and database-level data isolation.

## TestRail milestones and their functionality

**TestRail milestones serve as reference points** for marking significant project achievements such as software releases, beta versions, or major reviews. They enable teams to align testing goals with development efforts while providing centralized progress tracking across multiple test runs.

**Milestone creation requires only a name**, with optional fields including parent milestone (for hierarchical organization), description, start/end dates, external references, and completion status. The system supports **three milestone states**: Upcoming (created but not started), Open (actively in progress), and Completed (finished and closed).

**Critical to understand is that milestones require manual management** - they don't automatically start based on dates and must be manually initiated via the "Start Milestone" button. Starting a milestone automatically activates assigned test runs from "Upcoming" to "Active" status, while completing a milestone prevents further test assignments and cannot be reopened.

The **milestone dashboard provides real-time progress tracking** through visual charts, activity summaries, and **high-accuracy forecasting capabilities** based on historical data and team velocity. Advanced forecasting offers three accuracy levels and burndown charts for visual progress monitoring.

**Best practices for milestone effectiveness** include using parent milestones for major releases with child milestones for sprints, maintaining consistent naming conventions, and leveraging hierarchical structures for complex project tracking. However, users should plan for manual overhead in milestone lifecycle management and understand the permanent nature of milestone deletion.

## Current limitations and improvement opportunities

**TestRail faces severe customer support challenges** that significantly impact user satisfaction. Research reveals consistent reports of extended response delays (weeks or months), poor resolution quality with issues going unresolved, and inconsistent support availability. The company's decision to remove their customer forum due to overwhelming complaints eliminates community-based support options.

**Technical limitations create significant workflow friction**. TestRail lacks **native defect management**, requiring external tools like Jira for bug tracking and creating workflow fragmentation. The absence of **built-in requirements management** forces reliance on external systems, while the **single bug tracker limitation** per project problematizes enterprises using multiple tools.

**Modern feature gaps place TestRail at a competitive disadvantage**. While competitors have offered **AI capabilities since early 2024**, TestRail only provides "coming soon" promises for AI features. The platform lacks **predictive analytics**, advanced trend analysis, and **ML-based test prioritization** that modern QA teams expect.

**Performance and scalability issues** plague larger installations. The **write-heavy architecture struggles with I/O bottlenecks**, particularly on virtual machines. Database backends cannot effectively handle large data volumes, with users reporting the need to delete records to maintain performance. Cloud storage limitations (50GB Professional, 500GB Enterprise with additional charges) constrain enterprise usage.

**Cost concerns affect adoption**, with pricing starting at $34-37/user/month making it expensive for smaller teams. The subscription model includes **hidden fees for additional storage** and lacks guest licensing options, forcing payment for occasional users who need only view access.

Recent user feedback trends indicate **declining satisfaction** with multiple 1-star reviews citing system reliability issues, users actively seeking alternatives due to frustration with lack of updates, and reports of data accessibility issues affecting project timelines.

## Comprehensive TestRail export and migration guide

**TestRail provides multiple export pathways** for organizations migrating to alternative QA tools. The platform offers **three built-in export formats**: CSV (configurable sections with separated steps), Excel (.xlsx with preserved formatting), and XML (TestRail's proprietary format maintaining complete structure).

**API-based export provides the most comprehensive data extraction**. Key endpoints include `GET /api/v2/get_cases/{project_id}` for bulk test case retrieval with pagination support (250 records per request), `GET /api/v2/get_sections/{project_id}` for organizational structure, and `GET /api/v2/get_attachments_for_case/{case_id}` for file attachments.

**Rate limiting considerations are critical** - TestRail Cloud enforces 180 requests/minute (Professional) to 300 requests/minute (Enterprise), requiring implementation of exponential backoff retry logic and bulk endpoint usage. Authentication supports username/password via HTTP Basic Auth or API keys (recommended).

**Complete migration requires systematic data extraction**:

```python
# Core export structure for comprehensive migration
export_data = {
    'project': get_project(project_id),
    'cases': get_all_cases_with_pagination(project_id),
    'sections': get_sections(project_id),
    'suites': get_suites(project_id),
    'case_fields': get_case_fields(),
    'attachments': download_all_attachments(project_id),
    'runs': get_test_runs_with_results(project_id)
}
```

**Migration strategies for popular QA tools**:

**Jira/Xray migration** utilizes Xray Document Generator with custom templates mapping TestRail fields to Jira issue fields. The process involves filtering test cases via Jira navigator (`project = "PROJ" AND issuetype = Test`) and generating XLSX format using TestRail-compatible templates.

**Azure DevOps migration** requires CSV transformation to Test Case format, mapping TestRail "Title" to Azure DevOps "Title", "Steps" to "Steps", and handling priority/automation status fields. Migration requires "Basic + Test Plans" license level with 60MB maximum attachment size.

**PractiTest migration** supports API-based migration preserving hierarchical organization and custom fields. The platform offers bulk CSV/Excel imports and comprehensive custom field mapping capabilities.

**Critical migration considerations include preserving relationships** between test cases, suites, and runs through hierarchical structure export, handling custom field mappings (text, dropdown, multi-select, etc.), and addressing attachment migration challenges due to TestRail's changing APIs across versions.

**Common migration challenges require strategic solutions**: API rate limiting demands exponential backoff implementation, data format inconsistencies need comprehensive field mapping documentation, and attachment migration requires version-specific handling due to TestRail's evolving API structure.

## Migration best practices and tooling

**Pre-migration planning should include** comprehensive data auditing to inventory projects and custom fields, tool evaluation to verify target system capabilities, and migration strategy definition for full vs. incremental approaches.

**Community tools provide enhanced migration capabilities**. The Qase TestRail Migration tool (Python 3.11-based) offers full API-based migration preserving IDs and relationships. SpiraTest Migration Tool handles multiple TestRail versions (6.x, 7.x, 8.x) with custom field and attachment support. Enterprise solutions like OpsHub Integration Manager support 70+ ALM/DevOps tools with bidirectional sync capabilities.

**Post-migration verification requires** comparing record counts and key data points, testing workflows and integrations, and validating user access and permissions. Organizations should plan for cleanup activities, documentation updates, and system optimization in the new platform.

## Strategic considerations for TestRail adoption

Organizations evaluating TestRail must weigh its **established market presence and comprehensive integration capabilities** against **significant limitations in customer support, missing AI features, and architectural constraints**. While the platform provides mature test management functionality, the combination of poor support experiences, lack of modern features, and high costs creates compelling reasons to evaluate alternatives.

**For organizations currently using TestRail**, the comprehensive export capabilities and community migration tools provide viable pathways to modern QA platforms that address these limitations more effectively. The choice between continuing with TestRail or migrating should factor in the total cost of ownership, including support challenges, missing productivity features, and long-term strategic alignment with modern testing practices.

**TestRail's technical foundation remains solid** but lacks the innovation and support quality that modern QA teams require. Organizations should carefully evaluate these factors against their specific needs and consider the growing ecosystem of alternatives that provide better user experiences, advanced AI capabilities, and superior customer support.

# RayTest - Enterprise QA Testing Platform
## Complete Development Guide for Claude Code Terminal

### Project Overview
Build **RayTest** - a modern, AI-powered test management platform that serves as a comprehensive alternative to TestRail. This enterprise-grade solution supports 100+ concurrent users with cutting-edge 2025 features including AI test generation, self-healing automation, and predictive analytics.

### Key Objectives
- **Complete TestRail Migration** with full file support (screenshots, videos, documents)
- **AI-Powered Testing** with natural language test creation and self-healing
- **Modern UI** with white-red color scheme and real-time collaboration  
- **Desktop Application** with full offline capabilities
- **Enterprise Scalability** for 100+ concurrent users
- **Comprehensive Automation** supporting Playwright, Selenium, Cypress

## Technology Stack & Architecture

### Backend Technology Stack
```yaml
# Core Backend
runtime: "Node.js 18+ with TypeScript"
framework: "Express.js or Fastify"
database: "PostgreSQL 15+ (primary), Redis (cache/sessions)"
file_storage: "MinIO (S3-compatible)"
message_queue: "RabbitMQ"
search: "Elasticsearch"
monitoring: "Prometheus + Grafana"

# AI/ML Integration
ai_services:
  - "OpenAI GPT-4 (test generation, analysis)"
  - "@anthropic-ai/sdk (Claude for advanced reasoning)"
  - "TensorFlow.js (ML models)"
  - "Natural Language Processing libraries"

# Testing Frameworks
automation:
  - "@playwright/test (primary - 45.1% adoption rate 2025)"
  - "selenium-webdriver (grid management)"
  - "cypress (integration support)"
  - "k6 (performance testing)"
  - "@axe-core/playwright (accessibility)"

# Security & Compliance
security:
  - "OWASP ZAP integration"
  - "Snyk vulnerability scanning"
  - "GDPR/CCPA compliance tools"
```

### Frontend Technology Stack
```yaml
# Frontend Framework
framework: "React 18+ with TypeScript"
state_management: "Redux Toolkit (complex state) + Zustand (simple state)"
styling: "Styled-components with white-red design system"
ui_library: "Custom components built on headless UI primitives"
build_tool: "Vite (fast development)"
testing: "Jest + React Testing Library + Playwright"

# Real-time Features
realtime: "Socket.io for live collaboration"
offline: "Service Workers + IndexedDB"
pwa: "Progressive Web App capabilities"
```

### Desktop Application
```yaml
desktop:
  framework: "Electron (latest)"
  features:
    - "Native window controls"
    - "Auto-updates"
    - "Offline synchronization"
    - "Native screenshot capture"
    - "System notifications"
```

## Complete Project Structure

```
raytest/
├── README.md
├── package.json                         # Monorepo configuration
├── docker-compose.yml                   # Development environment
├── docker-compose.prod.yml              # Production environment
```

## Implementation Phases & Order

### Phase 1: Foundation Setup (Wochen 1-4)

   ```bash
   pnpm init
   ```

   - Setup PostgreSQL database with basic schema
   - Implement authentication (JWT, MFA, SSO)
   - Create basic API structure
   - Setup Redis for caching

3. **Database Schema Design**
   ```sql

   -- Migration tracking: migrations, migration_status
   -- AI data: ai_models, ai_training_data
   ```

## Design System: White-Red Color Scheme

```css
/* RayTest Design System */
:root {
  /* Primary Colors - Red */
  --ray-red-primary: #E53E3E;
  --ray-red-dark: #C53030;
  --ray-red-light: #FEB2B2;
  --ray-red-lightest: #FED7D7;
  
  /* Neutral Colors - White/Gray */
  --ray-white: #FFFFFF;
  --ray-gray-50: #F7FAFC;
  --ray-gray-100: #EDF2F7;
  --ray-gray-200: #E2E8F0;
  --ray-gray-300: #CBD5E0;
  --ray-gray-400: #A0AEC0;
  --ray-gray-500: #718096;
  --ray-gray-600: #4A5568;
  --ray-gray-700: #2D3748;
  --ray-gray-800: #1A202C;
  --ray-gray-900: #171923;
  
  /* Status Colors */
  --ray-success: #38A169;
  --ray-warning: #D69E2E;
  --ray-error: #E53E3E;
  --ray-info: #3182CE;
  
  /* Gradients */
  --ray-gradient-primary: linear-gradient(135deg, #E53E3E 0%, #C53030 100%);
  --ray-gradient-subtle: linear-gradient(135deg, #FED7D7 0%, #FFFFFF 100%);
}

/* Component Styles */
.btn-primary {
  background: var(--ray-gradient-primary);
  color: var(--ray-white);
  border: none;
  border-radius: 8px;
  padding: 12px 24px;
  font-weight: 600;
  transition: all 0.2s ease;
}

.btn-primary:hover {
  transform: translateY(-2px);
  box-shadow: 0 4px 12px rgba(229, 62, 62, 0.3);
}

.card {
  background: var(--ray-white);
  border-radius: 12px;
  padding: 24px;
  box-shadow: 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
  border-left: 4px solid var(--ray-red-primary);
}

.sidebar {
  background: var(--ray-white);
  border-right: 1px solid var(--ray-gray-200);
}

.navbar {
  background: var(--ray-white);
  border-bottom: 1px solid var(--ray-gray-200);
}
```

### Competitive Advantages
- **First-to-Market**: AI-powered self-healing test automation

- **Enterprise Scale**: 100+ concurrent users with real-time collaboration

This represents the most advanced QA testing platform possible with current technology, positioning RayTest as the definitive next-generation alternative to legacy tools like TestRail.

1.content:
Über PADERCLEAN – Meine Leidenschaft für saubere Fahrzeuge

Schon seit vielen Jahren habe ich eine große Leidenschaft dafür, Autos bis ins kleinste Detail zu pflegen und sauber zu halten. Angefangen hat alles ganz privat: Ich habe zunächst die Fahrzeuge von Familie, Freunden und natürlich mein eigenes Auto gereinigt. Dabei habe ich schnell gemerkt, wie viel Freude es mir bereitet, wenn ein Fahrzeug nach der Reinigung wieder wie neu wirkt – frisch riecht, glänzt und seinen Besitzern ein gutes Gefühl gibt.

Mit der Zeit habe ich meine Techniken perfektioniert und mich dazu entschieden, aus meinem Hobby mehr zu machen. So ist PADERCLEAN entstanden – mit dem Ziel, anderen Menschen das gleiche Gefühl von Freude und Zufriedenheit zu schenken.

Denn ich bin überzeugt: Ein sauberes Auto ist mehr als nur ein optischer Luxus. Es macht den Alltag angenehmer, sorgt für Wohlbefinden und unterstreicht die eigene Lebensqualität.
Mit Liebe zum Detail, Leidenschaft und dem Anspruch, jedes Auto so zu behandeln, als wäre es mein eigenes, sorge ich dafür, dass Sie Ihr Fahrzeug wieder rundum genießen können.

2.content:
Entwurf – Allgemeine Geschäftsbedingungen (AGB) für PADERCLEAN

1. Geltungsbereich

Diese Allgemeinen Geschäftsbedingungen (AGB) gelten für alle Verträge zwischen PADERCLEAN – Fahrzeuginnenreinigung, Inh. Taner Isik, und seinen Kunden. Abweichende Bedingungen des Kunden werden nicht anerkannt, es sei denn, ihrer Geltung wird ausdrücklich schriftlich zugestimmt.

2. Leistungsumfang

(1) PADERCLEAN bietet ausschließlich Dienstleistungen im Bereich Fahrzeuginnenreinigung (Innenraum) an.
(2) Die Leistungen können sowohl in den Geschäftsräumen von PADERCLEAN als auch beim Kunden vor Ort erbracht werden. Bei mobilen Einsätzen fällt eine Anfahrtspauschale an, die vorab vereinbart wird.
(3) Der genaue Leistungsumfang (z. B. Standard-Innenreinigung, Zusatzleistungen wie Lederpflege, Tierhaarentfernung etc.) ergibt sich aus dem jeweiligen Angebot oder der individuellen Vereinbarung.

3. Vertragsschluss

(1) Eine Terminvereinbarung per Telefon, E-Mail oder über das Kontaktformular stellt ein verbindliches Angebot des Kunden dar.
(2) Der Vertrag kommt erst mit der Bestätigung durch PADERCLEAN zustande.

4. Preise und Zahlung

(1) Es gelten die jeweils zum Zeitpunkt der Buchung aktuellen Preise gemäß der veröffentlichten Preisliste oder eines individuell erstellten Angebots.
(2) Gemäß §19 UStG wird keine Umsatzsteuer erhoben und daher auch nicht ausgewiesen (Kleinunternehmerregelung).
(3) Zahlungen sind unmittelbar nach Erbringung der Leistung fällig. Folgende Zahlungsarten werden akzeptiert:
    •    Barzahlung
    •    Überweisung (nach Rechnungserhalt)
    •    Rechnung für Firmenkunden
(4) Kartenzahlungen (EC-/Kreditkarte) sind derzeit nicht möglich.

5. Stornierungen und Terminabsagen

(1) Stornierungen durch den Kunden sind bis 24 Stunden vor dem vereinbarten Termin kostenfrei möglich.
(2) Bei späteren Stornierungen oder Nichterscheinen behält sich PADERCLEAN vor, eine Ausfallpauschale in Höhe von 50 % des vereinbarten Preises zu berechnen.
(3) Sollte PADERCLEAN einen Termin aus wichtigem Grund (z. B. Krankheit, technische Probleme) absagen müssen, wird der Kunde umgehend informiert. Bereits geleistete Zahlungen werden vollständig erstattet.

6. Haftung

(1) PADERCLEAN haftet für Schäden nur bei Vorsatz oder grober Fahrlässigkeit.
(2) Für bereits vorhandene Vorschäden oder normale Abnutzung (z. B. alte Polster, Kratzer, empfindliche Materialien) übernimmt PADERCLEAN keine Haftung.
(3) Der Kunde ist verpflichtet, PADERCLEAN vor Beginn der Reinigung auf empfindliche Materialien oder bekannte Vorschäden hinzuweisen.

7. Gutscheine und Rabatte

(1) Gutscheine können nur innerhalb des angegebenen Zeitraums eingelöst werden und sind nicht in bar auszahlbar.
(2) Mehrere Rabatte oder Gutscheine sind nicht kombinierbar, sofern nicht ausdrücklich etwas anderes vereinbart wurde.
(3) Beim Verlust von Gutscheinen übernimmt PADERCLEAN keine Haftung.

8. Gewährleistung

(1) Der Kunde hat die erbrachte Leistung unmittelbar nach Durchführung zu prüfen.
(2) Offensichtliche Mängel sind PADERCLEAN spätestens innerhalb von 24 Stunden nach Leistungserbringung mitzuteilen. Spätere Reklamationen können nicht berücksichtigt werden.

9. Datenschutz

PADERCLEAN verarbeitet personenbezogene Daten ausschließlich im Rahmen der geltenden Datenschutzgesetze. Nähere Informationen ergeben sich aus der Datenschutzerklärung auf der Website.

10. Schlussbestimmungen

(1) Es gilt das Recht der Bundesrepublik Deutschland.
(2) Gerichtsstand für Streitigkeiten ist, soweit gesetzlich zulässig, der Sitz von PADERCLEAN in Paderborn.
(3) Sollten einzelne Bestimmungen dieser AGB unwirksam sein oder werden, bleibt die Wirksamkeit der übrigen Regelungen unberührt.

1.content:
# Paderclean Website Development - Complete Modernization & Enhancement

## Project Overview
Transform the existing Paderclean car detailing website into a modern, professional, and fully functional business platform with improved user experience, responsive design, and streamlined booking process.

## Technical Framework Migration
**Primary Goal:** Migrate to modern JavaScript framework
- **Recommended:** Next.js (for SEO benefits and performance) or React
- **Alternative options:** Vue.js (easier learning curve)
- Maintain existing functionality while improving performance
- Implement proper component structure and state management
- Ensure backward compatibility during migration

## Critical Bug Fixes
1. **JavaScript Error Resolution**
   - Investigate and fix the error at `js/script.js:91:29`
   - Perform complete code audit for other potential issues
   - Implement proper error handling and logging

## Brand Identity & Visual Updates

### Logo & Branding
- Replace current logo with **car silhouette only** (minimize text dependency)
- Keep "Paderclean" text prominently displayed across site sections
- Create new favicon matching the car silhouette design
- Consider potential business name change evaluation

### Typography System
- **Headlines:** Montserrat or Poppins (choose one for consistency)
- **Body Text:** Nunito or Roboto (choose one for consistency)
- Implement proper font hierarchy and loading optimization

### Design Enhancements
- **Subpage Headers:** Redesign background sections for better visual impact
- **Animations:** Research and implement modern, smooth animations (consider Framer Motion for React/Next.js)
- **Responsive Design:** Ensure perfect display across all devices (mobile-first approach)

## Functionality Improvements

### Cookie Management System
- Implement comprehensive cookie logic for STRATO hosting environment
- **Current Issue:** Cookie settings only show on legal pages (Impressum, Datenschutz, AGB)
- **Required:** Persistent cookie preferences across all pages
- **Storage:** Implement local storage solution for user preferences
- **Compliance:** Ensure GDPR compliance with proper consent management

### Contact & Booking System Overhaul

#### Contact Form Modifications
- **Remove:** Separate date/time selection fields
- **Modify:** Message textarea to include time preference requests
- **Button Text:** Change "Nachricht senden" to "**Jetzt Termin anfragen**"
- **Integration:** Implement WhatsApp Business for image sharing workflow

#### Vehicle Classification System
Add dropdown/selection for:
- **Fahrzeugklassen:** Kleinwagen, Mittelklasse, Oberklasse
- **Verschmutzungsgrad:** Light, Medium, Heavy cleaning needed
- **Note:** Emphasize no fixed prices - provide price orientation only

### Navigation Improvements
- Make header "Paderclean" logo/emblem clickable → returns to homepage (index)
- Ensure consistent navigation across all pages

## Content Strategy & Updates

### Service Rebranding
- **Change:** "Innenreinigung" → "**Fahrzeugaufbereitung**" (more professional terminology)
- **Social Media:** Replace Facebook links with TikTok
- **Remove Completely:** "Ozon coming soon" section and references

### Homepage Content Updates

#### Pricing Section ("Unsere Preise")
- **Change:** "Preis" → "**Preise ab**"
- **Price Adjustment:** Increase all displayed prices by €10
- **Add Disclaimer:** Asterisk (*) after "Sparer Pakete" 
- **Explanation Text:** "Preise variieren je nach Fahrzeug. Angezeigte Preise gelten für Kleinwagen."

#### Service Icons
- **Missing Icon:** Add icon for "Scheibenreinigung" service
- Ensure all services have consistent, professional icons

#### Contact Section
- Update contact form button to match new "Jetzt Termin anfragen" terminology

### Payment Information
- Update "Wie kann ich bezahlen?" section with current payment methods
- Include modern payment options (PayPal, card payments, etc.)

### About Us Page ("Über Uns")
- **Complete Rewrite:** "Unsere Geschichte" section
- **Reference:** Use https://brekky.de/pages/grunderstory as inspiration for storytelling approach
- Focus on founder journey, company values, and local Paderborn connection

## Content Replacement Strategy
- **Phase 1:** Replace all sample/placeholder texts with authentic business content
- **Phase 2:** Replace stock images with professional photos of actual services
- **Phase 3:** Add customer testimonials and before/after galleries

## Development Priorities
1. **High Priority:** Fix JavaScript error and framework migration planning
2. **Medium Priority:** Cookie system implementation and responsive design
3. **Low Priority:** Content updates and visual enhancements

## Success Metrics
- Improved page load speeds (target: <3 seconds)
- Mobile-responsive design (100% compatibility)
- Increased conversion rate through improved booking flow
- GDPR-compliant cookie management
- Professional brand presentation

## Next Steps
1. Choose JavaScript framework and create migration plan
2. Design new car silhouette logo and favicon
3. Set up development environment with chosen framework
4. Begin systematic implementation of each TODO item
5. Test thoroughly on multiple devices and browsers

---

**Note:** This project transforms a basic car cleaning website into a professional, modern business platform that reflects the quality of Paderclean's services while improving user experience and conversion rates.

# 🔥 WINDOWS 11 - Exakte Schritt-für-Schritt Anleitung

## ⏱️ Zeitplan: ~30 Minuten für komplettes Setup

---

## 🎯 PHASE 1: Projekt Setup (5 Minuten)

### Schritt 1: PowerShell als Administrator öffnen
```powershell
# Windows-Taste + X → "Windows PowerShell (Administrator)"
# Oder: Windows-Taste → "powershell" → Rechtsklick → "Als Administrator ausführen"
```

### Schritt 2: Ordnerstruktur erstellen
```powershell
# Navigiere zu deinem gewünschten Verzeichnis (z.B. Desktop)
cd $env:USERPROFILE\Desktop

# Erstelle Projektordner
New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path "wolvesville-bot-system"
Set-Location "wolvesville-bot-system"

# Erstelle Unterordner
New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path "src"
New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path "logs"
New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path "screenshots"
New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path "monitoring"
```

### Schritt 3: package.json erstellen
```powershell
# Erstelle package.json mit Windows-Editor
notepad package.json
```

**Im Notepad:** Kopiere den kompletten Inhalt aus dem **package.json Artifact** und speichere (Ctrl+S, dann schließen).

### Schritt 4: Dependencies installieren
```powershell
npm install
```

**✅ Checkpoint: Du solltest jetzt `node_modules/` Ordner sehen**

---

## 🎯 PHASE 2: Core Files erstellen (10 Minuten)

### Schritt 5: Source-Dateien erstellen

**Option A: Mit Notepad (Einfacher)**
```powershell
# Erstelle jede Datei einzeln
notepad src\bot.js
# Kopiere Inhalt aus "src/bot.js" Artifact → Speichern

notepad src\config.js
# Kopiere Inhalt aus "src/config.js" Artifact → Speichern

notepad src\lobby-manager.js
# Kopiere Inhalt aus "src/lobby-manager.js" Artifact → Speichern
```

```powershell
npm start
```

### **Docker Desktop Requirements:**

### **Pfad-Probleme lösen:**

## 🚨 WINDOWS-SPEZIFISCHES TROUBLESHOOTING:

```powershell
# Node.js neu installieren von nodejs.org

refreshenv  # Falls Chocolatey installiert ist
```

### ❌ **"docker not found"**

```powershell
# Docker Desktop von docker.com herunterladen
# Nach Installation: System neu starten
# Docker Desktop starten und warten bis grüner Status
```

### ❌ **"Permission denied" bei Docker**
```powershell
# PowerShell als Administrator ausführen
# Oder: Docker Desktop → Settings → General → "Use WSL 2 based engine"
```

### ❌ **Port bereits in Verwendung**
```powershell
# Prüfe welche Prozesse Port 3001 verwenden
netstat -ano | findstr :3001

# Beende Prozess falls nötig
taskkill /PID [PID_NUMMER] /F
```

### ❌ **Pfad-Probleme mit Leerzeichen**

```powershell
# Verwende Anführungszeichen
Set-Location "C:\Users\Dein Name\Desktop\wolvesville-bot-system"
```

```bash
# Falls Git installiert ist, kannst du Git Bash verwenden
```

Du hast jetzt **5 Wolvesville Bots** auf Windows 11 am Laufen!

**Bei Problemen:** Nutze Windows-spezifische Befehle und prüfe Docker Desktop Status!

# Changelog

## 1.0.97

- Settings: /doctor now validates permission rule syntax and suggests corrections

## 1.0.94

- Vertex: add support for global endpoints for supported models
- /memory command now allows direct editing of all imported memory files
- SDK: Add custom tools as callbacks
- Added /todos command to list current todo items

## 1.0.93

- Windows: Add alt + v shortcut for pasting images from clipboard
- Support NO_PROXY environment variable to bypass proxy for specified hostnames and IPs

## 1.0.90

- Settings file changes take effect immediately - no restart required

## 1.0.88

- Fixed issue causing "OAuth authentication is currently not supported"
- Status line input now includes `exceeds_200k_tokens`
- Fixed incorrect usage tracking in /cost.
- Introduced `ANTHROPIC_DEFAULT_SONNET_MODEL` and `ANTHROPIC_DEFAULT_OPUS_MODEL` for controlling model aliases opusplan, opus, and sonnet.
- Bedrock: Updated default Sonnet model to Sonnet 4

## 1.0.86

- Added /context to help users self-serve debug context issues
- SDK: Added UUID support for all SDK messages
- SDK: Added `--replay-user-messages` to replay user messages back to stdout

## 1.0.85

- Status line input now includes session cost info
- Hooks: Introduced SessionEnd hook

## 1.0.84

- Fix tool_use/tool_result id mismatch error when network is unstable
- Fix Claude sometimes ignoring real-time steering when wrapping up a task
- @-mention: Add ~/.claude/\* files to suggestions for easier agent, output style, and slash command editing
- Use built-in ripgrep by default; to opt out of this behavior, set USE_BUILTIN_RIPGREP=0

## 1.0.83

- @-mention: Support files with spaces in path
- New shimmering spinner

## 1.0.82

- SDK: Add request cancellation support
- SDK: New additionalDirectories option to search custom paths, improved slash command processing
- Settings: Validation prevents invalid fields in .claude/settings.json files
- MCP: Improve tool name consistency
- Bash: Fix crash when Claude tries to automatically read large files

## 1.0.81

- Released output styles, including new built-in educational output styles "Explanatory" and "Learning". Docs: https://docs.anthropic.com/en/docs/claude-code/output-styles
- Agents: Fix custom agent loading when agent files are unparsable

## 1.0.80

- UI improvements: Fix text contrast for custom subagent colors and spinner rendering issues

## 1.0.77

- Bash tool: Fix heredoc and multiline string escaping, improve stderr redirection handling
- SDK: Add session support and permission denial tracking
- Fix token limit errors in conversation summarization
- Opus Plan Mode: New setting in `/model` to run Opus only in plan mode, Sonnet otherwise

## 1.0.73

- MCP: Support multiple config files with `--mcp-config file1.json file2.json`
- MCP: Press Esc to cancel OAuth authentication flows
- Bash: Improved command validation and reduced false security warnings
- UI: Enhanced spinner animations and status line visual hierarchy
- Linux: Added support for Alpine and musl-based distributions (requires separate ripgrep installation)

## 1.0.72

- Ask permissions: have Claude Code always ask for confirmation to use specific tools with /permissions

## 1.0.71

- Background commands: (Ctrl-b) to run any Bash command in the background so Claude can keep working (great for dev servers, tailing logs, etc.)
- Customizable status line: add your terminal prompt to Claude Code with /statusline

## 1.0.70

- Performance: Optimized message rendering for better performance with large contexts
- Windows: Fixed native file search, ripgrep, and subagent functionality
- Added support for @-mentions in slash command arguments

## 1.0.69

- Upgraded Opus to version 4.1

## 1.0.68

- Fix incorrect model names being used for certain commands like `/pr-comments`
- Windows: improve permissions checks for allow / deny tools and project trust. This may create a new project entry in `.claude.json` - manually merge the history field if desired.
- Windows: improve sub-process spawning to eliminate "No such file or directory" when running commands like pnpm
- Enhanced /doctor command with CLAUDE.md and MCP tool context for self-serve debugging
- SDK: Added canUseTool callback support for tool confirmation
- Added `disableAllHooks` setting
- Improved file suggestions performance in large repos

## 1.0.65

- IDE: Fixed connection stability issues and error handling for diagnostics
- Windows: Fixed shell environment setup for users without .bashrc files

## 1.0.64

- Agents: Added model customization support - you can now specify which model an agent should use
- Agents: Fixed unintended access to the recursive agent tool
- Hooks: Added systemMessage field to hook JSON output for displaying warnings and context
- SDK: Fixed user input tracking across multi-turn conversations
- Added hidden files to file search and @-mention suggestions

## 1.0.63

- Windows: Fixed file search, @agent mentions, and custom slash commands functionality

## 1.0.62

- Added @-mention support with typeahead for custom agents. @<your-custom-agent> to invoke it
- Hooks: Added SessionStart hook for new session initialization
- /add-dir command now supports typeahead for directory paths
- Improved network connectivity check reliability

## 1.0.61

- Transcript mode (Ctrl+R): Changed Esc to exit transcript mode rather than interrupt
- Settings: Added `--settings` flag to load settings from a JSON file
- Settings: Fixed resolution of settings files paths that are symlinks
- OTEL: Fixed reporting of wrong organization after authentication changes
- Slash commands: Fixed permissions checking for allowed-tools with Bash
- IDE: Added support for pasting images in VSCode MacOS using ⌘+V
- IDE: Added `CLAUDE_CODE_AUTO_CONNECT_IDE=false` for disabling IDE auto-connection
- Added `CLAUDE_CODE_SHELL_PREFIX` for wrapping Claude and user-provided shell commands run by Claude Code

## 1.0.60

- You can now create custom subagents for specialized tasks! Run /agents to get started

## 1.0.59

- SDK: Added tool confirmation support with canUseTool callback
- SDK: Allow specifying env for spawned process
- Hooks: Exposed PermissionDecision to hooks (including "ask")
- Hooks: UserPromptSubmit now supports additionalContext in advanced JSON output
- Fixed issue where some Max users that specified Opus would still see fallback to Sonnet

## 1.0.58

## 0.2.63

- Fixed an issue where MCP tools were loaded twice, which caused tool call errors

## 0.2.61

- Navigate menus with vim-style keys (j/k) or bash/emacs shortcuts (Ctrl+n/p) for faster interaction
- Enhanced image detection for more reliable clipboard paste functionality
- Fixed an issue where ESC key could crash the conversation history selector

## 0.2.59

- Copy+paste images directly into your prompt
- Improved progress indicators for bash and fetch tools
- Bugfixes for non-interactive mode (-p)

## 0.2.54

- Quickly add to Memory by starting your message with '#'
- Press ctrl+r to see full output for long tool results
- Added support for MCP SSE transport

## 0.2.53

- New web fetch tool lets Claude view URLs that you paste in
- Fixed a bug with JPEG detection

## 0.2.50

- New MCP "project" scope now allows you to add MCP servers to .mcp.json files and commit them to your repository

## 0.2.49

- Previous MCP server scopes have been renamed: previous "project" scope is now "local" and "global" scope is now "user"

## 0.2.47

- Press Tab to auto-complete file and folder names
- Press Shift + Tab to toggle auto-accept for file edits
- Automatic conversation compaction for infinite conversation length (toggle with /config)

## 0.2.44

- Ask Claude to make a plan with thinking mode: just say 'think' or 'think harder' or even 'ultrathink'

## 0.2.41

- MCP server startup timeout can now be configured via MCP_TIMEOUT environment variable
- MCP server startup no longer blocks the app from starting up

## 0.2.37

- New /release-notes command lets you view release notes at any time
- `claude config add/remove` commands now accept multiple values separated by commas or spaces

## 0.2.36

- Import MCP servers from Claude Desktop with `claude mcp add-from-claude-desktop`
- Add MCP servers as JSON strings with `claude mcp add-json <n> <json>`

## 0.2.34

- Vim bindings for text input - enable with /vim or /config

## 0.2.32

- Interactive MCP setup wizard: Run "claude mcp add" to add MCP servers with a step-by-step interface
- Fix for some PersistentShell issues

## 0.2.31

- Custom slash commands: Markdown files in .claude/commands/ directories now appear as custom slash commands to insert prompts into your conversation
- MCP debug mode: Run with --mcp-debug flag to get more information about MCP server errors

## 0.2.30

- Added ANSI color theme for better terminal compatibility
- Fixed issue where slash command arguments weren't being sent properly
- (Mac-only) API keys are now stored in macOS Keychain

## 0.2.26

- New /approved-tools command for managing tool permissions
- Word-level diff display for improved code readability
- Fuzzy matching for slash commands

## 0.2.21

- Fuzzy matching for /commands
